description: Borrowed from Italian spiccato, past participle of spiccare (“to detach, to separate”).

adjectives.description: spiccato (comparative more spiccato, superlative most spiccato)

entries.meaning: (music) detached; separated; with every note performed in a distinct and pointed manner.
(music) A manner of playing a stringed instrument such that the bow is bounced off the strings after each note.
